structure.unit: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES -- PROHIBITIONS, RESTRICTIONS, AND REGULATIONS

law.catch_line: Presence of alcoholic beverage raises presumption of intention to sell.
law.text: Whenever any alcoholic beverage, in whatever quantity, is found on any business premises within this state, a prima facie presumption shall arise that the alcoholic beverage was upon the premises for the purpose of sale.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-166.
